intro: Epaltes australis, commonly known as the Australian epaltes, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Epaltes australis is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
